issue.title: [C++] Add support for Bazel
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-6908](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6908). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I would like to use Arrow in a C++ project that uses Bazel.

 

Would it be possible to add support for building Arrow using Bazel?

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6908?focusedCommentId=16953332) by Micah Kornfield (emkornfield@gmail.com):*
Going to take a quick look to see what this would take.  `[~aryann]`  it seems like `[~bhulette]`'s suggestion might be the quickest path on this.  I'll keep the Jira updated.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6908?focusedCommentId=17394135) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Do we want to keep this open? It doesn't sound likely that anyone will contribute a Bazel build file in the near future, given how complicated our CMake files are...

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6908?focusedCommentId=17396398) by Micah Kornfield (emkornfield):*
no I think we can close for now.  It was a nicer developer experience but hard to maintain without buy in from active developers to maintain it once it is in place.
